pageContext.claim: “And by the way, we got rid of the mandate. Right? We got rid of the individual mandate, folks, the most unpopular part.... You had the privilege of paying a fortune in order to have the privilege of not having to pay a fortune for bad health care.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump signed a bill that reduced the tax penalty for not buying insurance to zero -- the mandate actually still exists -- but it was never "a fortune." The penalty was relatively small and many health-care experts thought it should have been higher. For people who bought insurance on the Obamacare exchanges and qualified for subsidies, the monthly premiums were generally under $100.
